meanings.sent1: The trisyllabic word was easy to pronounce.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with the trisyllabic name of the flower.
meanings.sent3: The trisyllabic song made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His trisyllabic chant echoed through the empty hallways.
meanings.sent5: The trisyllabic rhythm of the poem was soothing.

meanings.definition: A word or phrase with three syllables.
meanings.sent1: The teacher explained the meaning of the trisyllabic to the class.
meanings.sent2: He found it challenging to remember the trisyllabics for the spelling bee.
meanings.sent3: The trisyllabic in the song stuck in his head all day.
meanings.sent4: Her favorite trisyllabic was 'elephant' because it sounded majestic.
meanings.sent5: The trisyllabic in the title of the book caught her attention.
